name: TheAtlantic
text: "Let’s say, for instance, that you wanted to test everyone in the U.S. once a week. That’s 45 million tests a day. How can we get there?" @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob report on a new strategy to defeat the virus, even before a vaccine is found. https://t.co/NCb80kLN8h

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As America climbs out of its coronavirus recession, it must reinvest in its middle class, and in the people who will bring good, middle-class jobs forth in the economy," @jimtankersley writes: https://t.co/7fmub3wJeU

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At its core, amnesty is a recognition that there are more important things in this world than punishment," writes Michele Hall: https://t.co/gRy3rbreWp

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’d never written fiction that stays with a single character for hundreds of pages; it almost felt like too much freedom." Yaa Gyasi talks with Oliver Munday about writing her new novel, "Transcendent Kingdom": https://t.co/PzGqG2pJzE

name: TheAtlantic
text: HBO’s “Lovecraft Country” has received early praise from critics for using horror to dramatize the threat of racism. But the series stops short of deploying the genre to convey new insights about the perils of white supremacy, Hannah Giorgis argues. https://t.co/ZqvgFmO5an

name: TheAtlantic
text: The epic journey that Beyoncé depicts in her lush visual album "Black Is King" echoes Black Americans’ search for an ancestral home, Zandria F. Robinson writes. https://t.co/EzbrmeyN1q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Those who host social gatherings during the pandemic provoke moral indignation from others—but bringing in law enforcement will promote injustice, not reduce infections, @JuliaLMarcus writes. https://t.co/El47CyRIek

name: TheAtlantic
text: Contrary to President Trump’s claims, the USPS has both the money and the capacity to deal with a surge in mail-in ballots. But new policies could still get in the way of the election, @RussellBerman reports. https://t.co/sLNJXgk75F

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Like so many others, I’m staggered by daily bursts of upset and unknowingness, alternately depressed, anxious, angry, and distracted. There’s a whole-soul exhaustion born of living in the age of Trump." --  Joanne Freeman (@jbf1755):
https://t.co/Z5paCG2ujD

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "We could fix it, you know. We could shut things down, and wear masks, and get enough tests to contact trace and isolate people—if we all worked together, the whole country, united in our goal of giving children what they need." https://t.co/kRu6Hiy7Cn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Minnesota: Images of the North Star State - the 32nd in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America. https://t.co/kNxZecV1oW https://t.co/IwFIy3Haul

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: "Testing is a non-optional problem." https://t.co/VLWlxJaJTp via @yayitsrob and @alexismadrigal

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: "School, for some kids, is a basic, important place: It is their source of food, or where no adult hits them, or where they find reliable heat in the winter." https://t.co/47QKaFqiGY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At some point, this experience is our children’s actual lives, and they’ve lost something enormous. From the perspective of the kids, the pandemic has meant the profound and abrupt loss of school," @ChaviKar writes: https://t.co/OuTdIbenpt

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is a warning. https://t.co/RnQFnSFWlL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @GrahamDavidA: An oral history of Bush v. Gore and the 2000 election recount, by me, @AmyWeissMeyer, Ena Alvarado-Esteller, and Cullen Murphy: https://t.co/YX6SOwP5FF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @LoriGottlieb1: “Every time you have the knee-jerk reaction that you have no choice in the matter, remind yourself that you can choose to say no, but you can also choose to say yes.”
 
This week ⁦⁦@TheAtlantic⁩ —
Repairing a relationship rift https://t.co/yMlQGORUsV

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump has continued to lie about the reason for surges in COVID-19 infections, blaming Mexico and the recent racial-justice protests. That and more in @realcpaz's tracker: https://t.co/bDqszgHclN

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: I’ve been covering COVID-19 testing with @alexismadrigal for the last six months. We’ve kept coming back to the same questions: Why is testing still broken in America? Can it be fixed? Should we even try to fix it now?

This is our attempt at an answer: https://t.co/f4UyuMV97R

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The story of the 2000 Florida recount offers a reminder of just how chaotic the electoral process can become—and of how disarray in a single state can undermine faith in the democratic process nationwide." https://t.co/mvbJCWMXMC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Millions of kids are doing their schoolwork on their phones, in parking lots, or not at all. @olgakhazan reports on why so many Americans still don't have internet: https://t.co/DrrKuyHyX5

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: If the government treated tests like it does vaccines, then we might be able to get back to something like normal life soon. We could reopen schools, offices, restaurants, and more. 

Your day might look a little like this: 

https://t.co/f4UyuMV97R (21/n) https://t.co/YadkTuyP8e

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "In the same way that a shark that is alive must swim, a child who is alive needs to be in a constant state of movement and change. When the forward motion stops, something is very wrong." https://t.co/F7myPH9qyy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: How did it get so bad? Another good question. Essentially, the U.S. has failed to treat the internet like it does other public utilities, and now we're suffering the consequences https://t.co/V9HsYXTOTU https://t.co/TSdcNn2zZ0

name: TheAtlantic
text: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill has switched to remote learning after a spike in COVID-19 cases. “Universities have no business reopening if they can’t provide a healthy environment," Julia Marcus and Jessica Gold wrote in July. https://t.co/OICNbguP8J

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: All this has happened before, and will happen again: https://t.co/cBBboAtjip

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is it just us, or are a lot of people buying cars right now? Listen to @yayitsrob and @jameshamblin discuss "COVID cars" on the podcast "Social Distance." https://t.co/mW7iRPz6NY

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose girlfriend won’t speak to him, because he asked her to move out. https://t.co/q1yXXEQill
